flush() - Method in class org.mozilla.telemetry.measurement.StaticMeasurement
 
flush() - Method in class org.mozilla.telemetry.measurement.TelemetryMeasurement
Flush this measurement in order for serializing a ping. Calling this method should create an Object representing the current state of this measurement. Optionally this measurement might be reset. For example a TelemetryMeasurement implementation for the OS version of the device might just return a String like "7.0.1". However a TelemetryMeasurement implementation for counting the usage of search engines might return a HashMap mapping search engine names to search counts. Additionally those counts will be reset after flushing.
flush() - Method in class org.mozilla.telemetry.measurement.TimezoneOffsetMeasurement

recordSearch() - Method in class org.mozilla.telemetry.measurement.SearchesMeasurement
Record a search for the given location and search engine identifier.
recordSearch() - Method in class org.mozilla.telemetry.Telemetry
Record a search for the given location and search engine identifier. Common location values used by Fennec and Focus: actionbar: the user types in the url bar and hits enter to use the default search engine listitem: the user selects a search engine from the list of secondary search engines at the bottom of the screen suggestion: the user clicks on a search suggestion or, in the case that suggestions are disabled, the row corresponding with the main engine

setBuildId() - Method in class org.mozilla.telemetry.config.TelemetryConfiguration
Get the build id of the app (e.g. 20150125030202). This value is used as one dimension when uploading telemetry to the HTTP Edge server.
setCollectionEnabled() - Method in class org.mozilla.telemetry.config.TelemetryConfiguration
Enable or disable collection of telemetry data. Local dev builds should disable this to avoid collecting and sending any data.
setConnectTimeout() - Method in class org.mozilla.telemetry.config.TelemetryConfiguration
Sets a specified timeout value, in milliseconds, to be used when opening a communications link to the telemetry endpoint. If the timeout expires before the connection can be established, the ping upload will be retried at a later time. A timeout of zero is interpreted as an infinite timeout.
setDataDirectory() - Method in class org.mozilla.telemetry.config.TelemetryConfiguration
Set the root directory where telemetry components should store data.
setDefaultSearchEngineProvider() - Method in class org.mozilla.telemetry.measurement.DefaultSearchMeasurement
 
setDefaultSearchProvider() - Method in class org.mozilla.telemetry.Telemetry
 
setInitialBackoffForUpload() - Method in class org.mozilla.telemetry.config.TelemetryConfiguration
Set the interval (in milliseconds) to wait initially after a ping upload has failed.
setMaximumNumberOfEventsPerPing() - Method in class org.mozilla.telemetry.config.TelemetryConfiguration
Set the maximum number of events per ping. If this limit is reached a ping will built and stored automatically. The number of stored and uploaded pings might be limited too.
setMaximumNumberOfPingsPerType() - Method in class org.mozilla.telemetry.config.TelemetryConfiguration
Set the maximum number of pings that will be stored for a given ping type. If more types are in the local store then pings will be removed (oldest first). For this to happen the maximum needs to be reached without any successful upload.
setMaximumNumberOfPingUploadsPerDay() - Method in class org.mozilla.telemetry.config.TelemetryConfiguration
Set the maximum number of pings uploaded per day. This limit is enforced for every type. If you have 2 ping types and set a limit of 100 pings per day then in total 200 pings per day could be uploaded.
setMinimumEventsForUpload() - Method in class org.mozilla.telemetry.config.TelemetryConfiguration
Set the minimum number of telemetry events that need to be fired before even trying to upload an event ping. The default value is 3. The minimum needs to be >= 1.
setPreferencesImportantForTelemetry() - Method in class org.mozilla.telemetry.config.TelemetryConfiguration
Set a list of preference keys that are important for telemetry. Some measurements and pings might use this to determine what preferences should be reported.
setReadTimeout() - Method in class org.mozilla.telemetry.config.TelemetryConfiguration
Sets the read timeout to a specified timeout, in milliseconds. A non-zero value specifies the timeout when reading from the telemetry endpoint. If the timeout expires before there is data available for read, the ping upload will be retried later. A timeout of zero is interpreted as an infinite timeout.
setServerEndpoint() - Method in class org.mozilla.telemetry.config.TelemetryConfiguration
Set the server endpoint to upload telemetry pings to. And endpoint value should include the schema and no trailing slash, e.g.: https://telemetry.example.org
setSettingsProvider() - Method in class org.mozilla.telemetry.config.TelemetryConfiguration
Set a provider for reading app settings.

setUpdateChannel() - Method in class org.mozilla.telemetry.config.TelemetryConfiguration

setUploadEnabled() - Method in class org.mozilla.telemetry.config.TelemetryConfiguration
Enable or disable the upload of collected telemetry data. This is usually set based on a user visible preference.
setUserAgent() - Method in class org.mozilla.telemetry.config.TelemetryConfiguration

T

Telemetry - Class in org.mozilla.telemetry
 
Telemetry() - Constructor for class org.mozilla.telemetry.Telemetry
 
TelemetryClient - Interface in org.mozilla.telemetry.net
 
TelemetryConfiguration - Class in org.mozilla.telemetry.config
The TelemetryConfiguration class collects the information describing the telemetry setup of an app. There are some parts that every app needs to configure: Where should measurements store data? What servers are we actually uploading pings to? This class should provide good defaults so that in the best case it is not needed to modify the configuration.
TelemetryConfiguration() - Constructor for class org.mozilla.telemetry.config.TelemetryConfiguration
 
TelemetryCorePingBuilder - Class in org.mozilla.telemetry.ping
This mobile-specific ping is intended to provide the most critical data in a concise format, allowing for frequent uploads. Since this ping is used to measure retention, it should be sent each time the app is opened. https://gecko.readthedocs.io/en/latest/toolkit/components/telemetry/telemetry/data/core-ping.html
TelemetryCorePingBuilder() - Constructor for class org.mozilla.telemetry.ping.TelemetryCorePingBuilder
 
TelemetryEvent - Class in org.mozilla.telemetry.event
TelemetryEvent specifies a common events data format, which allows for broader, shared usage of data processing tools.
TelemetryEventPingBuilder - Class in org.mozilla.telemetry.ping
A telemetry ping builder for pings of type "focus-event".
TelemetryEventPingBuilder() - Constructor for class org.mozilla.telemetry.ping.TelemetryEventPingBuilder
 
TelemetryHolder - Class in org.mozilla.telemetry
Holder of a static reference to the Telemetry instance. This is required for background services that somehow need to get access to the configuration and storage. This is not particular nice. Hopefully we can replace this with something better.
